entry.title: Drops cronjob without requiring cron
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. On a current Fedora installation install google-chrome-stable from the provided repository 2. Verify /etc/cron.daily/google-chrome is created, but no cron is installed 3. Cronjob will not be executed so no update of the repository and signing key will happen
# Problem Description If you look at the filelist of the package you will notice the cronjob dropped at /etc/cron.daily/google-chrome, but looking at the requirements you will not find a requirement on any cron implementation.
$ rpm -ql google-chrome-stable /etc/cron.daily/google-chrome ...
$ rpm -q --requires google-chrome-stable ...
Having a requirement on cron is only an intermediate solution I think as I see distributions moving forward on dropping cron in favour of systemd-timers, so dropping the current cronjob instead as a script in /usr/bin/ or somewhere under /opt/google/ and adding a systemd service unit of type oneshot started by a systemd timer unit would be the way to go on newer Linux distributions.
Just as a reference if whoever is reading my suggestion is not familiar with systemd-timers: https://opensource.com/article/20/7/systemd-timers
# Summary Drops cronjob without requiring cron
# Additional Data Category: Installation \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: [Chromium GSoC] Request for Feedback
entry.content:
*Instructions:*
*1) Choose if this is a general question about the project (if so choose template 1) or if this is a request for a review of a proposal (if so choose template 2 below)*
*2) Fill in the template completely and delete the instructions and the unused template*
*3) Update the title to reflect your question or "proposal submission for <your name>"*
*4) Submit and wait for the mentors to provide feedback*.
*--------------- Template 1 ------------------*
**Question about Project**
*Delete this and the below paragraphs and ask your question here, recall that there is lots of material for routine questions. Please go through the [project list](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/15tLikPVkKrkz53RVG1ncY-8PpWA4dgZU0-5kl-uB4dg/edit#slide=id.g1f110b421e3_1_95), if you are interested get started on the starter bugs / starter milestone listed on the project doc of each project.*
*If you want a head start or interested in contributing to chromium you can check out the “[Life of a Chromium Developer](https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/chromium-dev/c/ybLzH8-FoTc/m/YhTe2g9L7CUJ)”, “[contributing](https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/contributing.md)”, or “[getting involved](https://www.chromium.org/getting-involved)” for information about getting the code and general flow of making a change to the code base.*
*If you have general questions not about a project you should instead email the mailing list chromium-gsoc@chromium.org and the admins can assist you.*
*--------------- Template 2 ------------------*
**Request For Project Proposal Review**
Please use our [template for a proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IOj4hSdPl8h1-8zYK_Gt3OxA0R44SLbmr-ZH3f9yDXM/edit?usp=sharing)
But we also encourage you to read GSoC's [writing a proposal](https://google.github.io/gsocguides/student/writing-a-proposal) and [example proposal](https://google.github.io/gsocguides/student/proposal-example-1). We suggest you reach out early engage with the starter bug of your project, and submit a proposal soon after you have a handle on the problem.
* Link to Google doc that contains your proposal: * Desired Project length (if different from project slide's suggestions): * Desired Project size (if different from project slide's suggestions): *Small/Medium/Large* * Any additional comments:

entry.title: Tests are failing: ninja://ios/chrome/test/earl_grey2:ios_chrome_integration_eg2tests_module/NTPHomeTestCase/testInvalidURL
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures with the test name: ninja://ios/chrome/test/earl_grey2:ios_chrome_integration_eg2tests_module/NTPHomeTestCase/testInvalidURL
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/306c2c1fec168e03ddb594929e9f67dc
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Debug check failed: IsWasmDispatchTable(table)
entry.content: deleted

entry.title: Incorrect HDR tone mapping when multiple display connected
entry.content:
If we connect two display, one enabled HDR, the other one disabled HDR. then Chrome will do wrong HDR tone-mapping on the display that disabled HDR.
This CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5111159 exposed the original issue. So I am going to submit a fix for this...

entry.title: [V8 Perf Sheriff]: 1 regressions in v8.browsing_mobile-future
entry.content:
All graphs for this regression group at 1262240:1262254:
Internal (Googlers-only) Reports: - Chromium: https://chrome-perf.corp.goog/_/alertgroup?group_id=c35a04e3-8d1e-4f79-ad0e-274c62969f5e
(Legacy) Chromeperf Report: https://chromeperf.appspot.com/group_report?group_id=c35a04e3-8d1e-4f79-ad0e-274c62969f5e
Top 1 regressions (out of 1, with 0 improvements) in this group: - ChromiumPerf/android-pixel4-perf/v8.browsing_mobile-future/Parse-Background:duration_avg/browse_shopping/browse_shopping_flipkart_2019 29.63%: 244.0825 -> 316.402
Top 1 affected measurements in android-pixel4-perf: - v8.browsing_mobile-future/Parse-Background:duration_avg/browse_shopping/browse_shopping_flipkart_2019 29.63%: 244.0825 -> 316.402
Regressions grouped by v8.browsing_mobile-future includes data from the following benchmarks with listed owners: v8.browsing_mobile-future: None
Commits in this range:

entry.title: Correctly use key kBrowserStatesLastActive (at the moment it's never used)
Don't send empty priority header
entry.content: Chrome currently sends an empty value for the priority header when all values are the default. The header should be omitted in that case per RFC 8941 https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8941.html#section-3.2-15

entry.title: Emoji presentation scanner maintains two UTF16RagelIterators leading to duplicate calls per codepoint
entry.content:
The Ragel generated emoji presentation scanner is mapped to working on top of `UTF16RagelIterator`. Increment, decrement and assign operations in the Ragel scanner (which usually access `chars` directly) are mapped to overloaded operator implementations. A change of cursor position leads to updating the internally stored emoji presentation category.
Because the scanner internally performs assignments, which may include copy assignments, in some situations two `UTF16RagelIterator` instances are active at the same time. Due to the order in which the scanner increments them, it looks like we perform multiple emoji category lookup per cursor position in the input text run.

entry.title: Not able to search xpath located elements from inspector console (DevTools - Elements tab)
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 121.0.6167.185 (Oficjalna wersja) (64-bitowa) (cohort: Stable) OS : Wersja Windows 11 Enterprise, 23H2, 22631.3155, Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.22684.1000.0
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to prepared demo Service Now instance -> https://dev203607.service-now.com
2. Login as demo user user_name: chrome.dev user_password: Demo_password1 *if needed i may reset pwd - just let me know
3. After login with mentioned user creds go to demo created incident -> https://dev203607.service-now.com/now/nav/ui/classic/params/target/incident.do%3Fsys_id%3Da83820b58f723300e7e16c7827bdeed2%26sysparm_view%3Dess%26sysparm_record_target%3Dincident%26sysparm_record_row%3D1%26sysparm_record_rows%3D1%26sysparm_record_list%3Dcaller_id%253Djavascript%253Ags.getUserID%2528%2529%255Eactive%253Dtrue%255Euniversal_requestISEMPTY%255EORDERBYDESCnumber
Open page inspector (DevTools Elements) and try to find 2 locators with ctrl+f option. 1st. el. is inside gsft_main iframe, 2nd. el is outside gsft_main frame.
eg. xpath locators for tests: 1) inside gsft_main iframe (expected) -> //*[@id="sys_readonly.incident.number"] 2) outside gsft_main iframe (unexpected) - > //div[@id="1b682fe1c3133010cbd77096e940dd18"]
What is the expected result? Inside gsft_main frame we're able to search for xpath locators as expected. Expected results is that we will be able to find mentioned elements inside and outside gsft_main iframe from DevTools Elements tab
What happens instead? Expected elements from outside gsft_main iframe are not visible in (DevTools Elements not show any element which is in page source). Outside gsft_main frame we're not able to find elements. (see screenshots below) eg. xpath locator to "Favourites" button - > //div[@id="1b682fe1c3133010cbd77096e940dd18"]
If any more details needed please let me know, i can prep live hands on demo to show an issue.

When he opened up the Discover view in iOS Chrome, it showed multiple parcel tracking (Fedex specifically) popups in the view. He has no idea what those parcels are. One of the parcels even had a tracking number looking like a test data (no.: 123456789012).

entry.title: Reconsider whether IdentityManager completely disabling scope checking is the right approach
entry.content:
As part of crbug.com/40066882, https://crrev.com/c/4786107 introduced a parameter to bypass scope access validation on iOS, with TODOs to do the same on other platforms.
During a code review, bsazonov@ pointed out that this may not be the desired end state.
This bug is about reconsidering this decision and possibly coming up with a better replacement to fully disabling scope access validation.

Issue manually filed by: clemensb
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.title: Constant mat2x2[2] in glsl breaks metal backend
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 122.0.6261.49 (Official Build) (arm64) OS: MacOS 13.6.4
What steps will reproduce the problem?
(1) Set "Choose ANGLE graphics backend" to "Metal" in chrome://flags/ (2) Open attached mat2x2[2].html
What is the expected result?
* A blue rectangle should be shown
What happens instead?
* Nothing is shown.
* The following error is shown in the Developer Console
[.WebGL-0x13400c27000] GL_INVALID_OPERATION: Error: 0x00000502, in ../../third_party/angle/src/libANGLE/renderer/metal/mtl_utils.mm, CreateMslShader:1810. Metal backend encountered an error

entry.title: Unable to share screen in Google meet after leaving share pop-up idle for about 3 minutes
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 123.0.6310.0 (Official Build) canary (arm64) 98320a8d4b6a12a0f142eeaffa98831bc0e7a487-refs/branch-heads/6310@{#1}
OS : Mac,Win(10,11),Linux
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and join any Google meet 2. Click on Share icon 3. Leave the system idle for about 3 minutes 4. Click on any option to share: tab, window or entire screen 5. Observe the error message: Can’t share your screen - Sorry, an error has occurred when screen sharing
Actual Result: “Can’t share your screen - Sorry, an error has occurred when screen sharing” message is observed
Expected Result: Screen sharing must happen
This issue exists from M-111 onwards .So, raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the screenshot below: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ysYDzYktaC2tLC-u8lxmH5fwxQRq8TfI/view?usp=drive_link
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Beta #122.0.6261.49, Dev #123.0.6300.3 and Stable #122.0.6261.49 2)As this is a Non-Regression issue, changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Thanks..!!

entry.title: Recalculate layout with rule.style change while opened devtools
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. open rule.style.html in google chrome or another chromium browser 2. open devtools 3. click the button (one or many times)
# Problem Description You'll see that the text positioned on left: 150px, not 999px. That happens because in for loop construction we read the offsetLeft of the element, and therefore layout was calculated on this position. But after exiting the loop, we can see that the layout not recalculated, even css styles show that left is 999px, but getComputedStyle().left will show 150px.
Line `$div.style.cssText = $div.style.cssText;` will fix layout recalculation. Any change on element.style will force recalculate layout. Properties that usually triggers recalculate layout like offsetLeft, offsetHeight or method getBoundingClientRect will not force recalculate layout. Closed devtools will fix layout recalculation. Starting Performance record will force recalculate.
# Additional Comments I noticed that the CSSStyleDeclaration from CSSStyleRule will not works properly with opened devtools, but CSSStyleDeclaration from element.style works properly.
# Summary Recalculate layout with rule.style change while opened devtools
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Tests are failing: androidx.test.espresso.AmbiguousViewMatcherException: 'with id: org.chromium.chrome.tests:id/large_message_card_item' matches multiple views in the...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): androidx.test.espresso.AmbiguousViewMatcherException: 'with id: org.chromium.chrome.tests:id/large_message_card_item' matches multiple views in the hierarchy.
Problem views are marked with '****MATCHES****' below.

View Hierarchy:
+>DecorView{id=-1, visibility=VISIBLE, width=1080, height=1920, has-focus=true, has-focusable=true, has-window-focus=true, is-clickable=false, is-enabled=true, is-focused=false, is-focusable=false, is-layout-requested=false, is-selected=false, root-is-layout-requested=false, has-input-connection=false, x=0.0, y=0.0, child-count=3} 
|
+->LinearLayout{id=-1, visibility=VISIBLE, width=1080, height=1794, has-focus=true, has-focusable=true, has-window-focus=true, is-clickable=false, is-enabled=true, is-focused=false, is-focusable=false, is-layout-requested=false, is-selected=false, root-is-layout-requested=false, has-input-connection=false, x=0.0, y=0.0, child-count=2} 
|

entry.title: Dynamic video 'scrubbing' with JS and currentTime not working since last update.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open codepen in chrome and scroll down, video should scrub through - it doesn't 2. Open codepen in safari and scroll down, video scrubs through the progress smoothly
# Problem Description Hi there -
This codepen ties the scroll progress to the video progress by tapping into currentTime. In the latest version of chrome this video doesn't scrub smoothly, it takes a few seconds to catch up and then "jumps" to the new time stamp.
# Additional Comments Here's a codepen demostrating the issue. Thanks!
https://codepen.io/GreenSock/pen/WNmmaBd
# Summary Dynamic video 'scrubbing' with JS and currentTime not working since last update.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Media
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: requestVideoFrameCallback does not contain captureTimestamp when abs-capture-time header extension is negotiated
Do something with CSS*InterpolationTypes that use double only InterpolableNumber
entry.content:
Some CSS*InterpolationTypes use InterpolableNumber as double-only storage (no css math expression), so, calls to InterpolableNumber::Value(length_resolver) look as an overkill as a use of InterpolableNumber itself.
Think about what to do with it later. Maybe reintroduce InterpolableDouble?

entry.title: Memory consumption is increasing after every page reload if developer tools are open.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open any website - for example https://google.com 2. Open developer tools and Memory tab 3. Reload page. 4. As result memory consumed by main thread is increasing after every reload.
# Problem Description Reproduced on 3 out of 4MacBooks Pro (M1 and M2 processors). "Preserve log" options in Network and Console tabs are turned off.
# Summary Memory consumption is increasing after every page reload if developer tools are open.
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Print does not respect bottom margin
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open the attached HTML 2. Open Print Preview 3. Choose Paper size A5 and Custom margins (0.39'' all, bottom 1.6'')
# Problem Description The bottom margin in HTML on the body is not respected. It's large enough to fit the footer however the footer overlaps the content. See the attached bad.png. Setting paper margin to e.g. 1.18'' renders correctly, see attached ok.png
It used to work fine e.g. in Chrome 84
# Summary Print does not respect bottom margin
# Custom Questions #### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Which other browsers (including versions) also have the problem? Firefox prints footer on the first page, it should be on the second page.
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: [iOS] check_static_initializer.py has no effect on Chromium.app
entry.content:
Hi team,
Based on previous 'check_static_initializer.py' has supported for ios (https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4233899):
I find some static initializers in Chromium by xcode instruments (picture 1). I try to use 'check_static_initializer.py' to check the 'Chromium.app' but it can't detect any static initializer (picture 2). I debugged and found that the variable 'rc' detected was 0. I try to commit a cl 'https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5302978' to test check_static_initializers.py is or not worked. Theoretically it should not pass the CQ DRY RUN, but it passed.
My question is why the script has no effect on 'Chromium.app'. Is there any special reason or the script has been not worked?
Thanks!
